column4: On my Ubuntu, I don't have access to /home, so I can't login or anything. Is there anyone who know how such a problem may be fixed?
What do you mean you don't have access to home?
But you can log in?
Failsafe terminal?
yes
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=545239 Perhaps that might help.
Markus: More like http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=545239 really.
Okay, that was the same link. This is the right one: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=545242

those people have problems with their X-server. My problem is the fact that I am locked out from /home and all its subfolders. This leaves me unable to log in in any other way than failsafe terminal, simply because all settings for GNOME (failsafe or not) is located inside the /home-directory.
Maybe login as root and change permissions for the directories under /home?
That's strange.
Subdirectories included
Do it with your username, not numbers.
As in, a+x and the such.
Could you paste them there?
True. *rolls eyes*.
What did it say when you tried to cd into /home?
And you tried sudo, right?
And did you become root and cd into it to see if you can?
Have you installed Ubuntu recently or has this just "randomly" happened?
Well, you shouldn't have write-permissions for /home, but you should have them for your _folder__under__/home_.
=P
